Counsellor's Name
Date of assessment
Risk Stratification
I’m going to ask you some questions to better understand your HIV risk. These can be very personal questions and may be hard to answer. In order to accurately understand your risk for HIV, I need to ask these questions and I need you to answer them as honestly as possible. If you need a moment to think before answering that is fine. Whatever we discuss will remain confidential
Note: When using the tool, if someone reports never having an HIV test remove “since your last HIV test” from the beginning of the question.
Is this HIV test based on a clinician/doctor’s request?
When was your most recent HIV test done and what was the result? Approximate date of (or months/years/weeks since) last HIV test?
Since your last HIV test, have you had a blood or blood product transfusion?
Since your last HIV test, have you had anal or vaginal sex without a condom with one or more persons who were either known to be HIV positive or who you were unaware of their HIV status?
Since your last HIV test, have you experienced painful urination, lower abdominal pain, vaginal or penile discharge, pain during sexual intercourse, thick, cloudy, or foul smelling discharge and/or small bumps or blisters near the mouth, penis, vagina, or anal areas?
Do you currently have any of the following TB symptoms: cough, fever, unexplained weight loss, or night sweats?
Since your last HIV test, have you shared needles or other sharp objects with someone known to be HIV positive or who you didn’t know their HIV status?
Since your last HIV test, have you paid for or sold anal, oral or vaginal sex?
Since your last HIV test, have you been forced to have sex?
